2006170-d-06-05-06-ICE.Maintenance Railroad Name: IOWA CHICAGO AND EASTERN RAILROAD CORPORATION
2006170-d-06-05-06-ICE.Narrative: EXTRA LOCAL 968 WAS PUTTING THE MBRCHU-04 INTO THE YARD AT DUBUQUE.  THEY SHOVED 40 CARS INTO TRACK5 AND THEN PULLED AHEAD AND SHOVED 21 CARS INTO TRACK 7 AND THEN PULLED AHEAD TO GO TO TRACK 8 AND LOST THE AIR.  UPON INSPECTION, THEY FOUND THAT 4 CARS HAD DERAILED INTO THE SIDE OF THE MKCSP-03.  THE EXTRA LOCAL HAD RUN THROUGH THE FENGLER STREET CROSSOVER SWITCH WHEN THEY SHOVED INTO TRACK 5 ANDTHEN PULLED AHEAD AND SHOVED INTO TRACK 7.  WHEN THEY PULLED OUT OF TRACK 7 IS WHEN THE AIR WENT.UTILITY MAN WAS AT THE TRACK 8 SWITCH AND DIDN`T SEE ANYTHING WRONG UNTIL HE STARTED WALKING TO THEFRONT OF THE TRAIN.  HE WAS THE EMPLOYEE THAT LINED THE SWITCH WRONG.  THE FOREMAN WAS ON THE CAR AND RODE THE SHOVE THROUGH THE MISLINED SWITCH.  UTILITY MAN HAD TOLD THE FOREMAN THAT HE WAS ALL LINED UP FOR TRACK 5.  FOREMAN GOT ON THE CAR AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TO START BACKING UP AND IT WOULD BE40 CARS TO A CUT.  HE DID NOT NOTICE THE SWITCH IMPROPERLY LINED.  CARS DERAILED:  DME 51579, UTLX 640073, SDPX 97086, AND SDPX 97028.  THE CREW WAS DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED WITH NEGATIVE RESULTS.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

06110-d-06-27-06-URR.Narrative: #9 CREW WAS SWITCHING CARS ON THE SOUTH END OF THE CLASSIFICATION YARD.  CREW WAS SHOVING SEVEN CARSNORTH TOWARDS #SIX CLASS WHEN THE CAR NEXT TO LOCOMOTIVE (KEYX 9006) DERAILED TWO WHEELS (B-END) ATTHE MS-50 SWITCH.  MOVEMENT CONTINUED NORTH DERAILING ALL WHEELS OF BOTH LOCOMOTIVES URR #20 AND URR 30 AT SWITCH.  THE MS-50 SWITCH IS IN THE REVERSE POSITION FOR MOVEMENT INTO #SIX CLASS, INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT THE POINT DETECTOR ROD ON THE MS-50 SWITCH (AIR POWER SWITCH) FELL OFF UNDER TRAFFICDUE TO MISSING BOLT, CAUSING THE SWITCH TO THROW BACK TO ITS NORMAL POSITION WHILE MOVEMENT WAS MADE OVER SWITCH.

525281-d-06-17-06-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Vandalism of track or track appliances, e.g., objects  placed on track, switch thrown, etc.
525281-d-06-17-06-WC.Accident Cause: Vandalism of track or track appliances, e.g., objects  placed on track, switch thrown, etc.
525281-d-06-17-06-WC.Narrative: TRAIN M35761-16 SET OUT 33 LOADS AND 26 EMPTIES ON TRACK I003 AND TOOK THEIR POWER TO THE ROUNDHOUSE.  THE TRAIN WAS HANGING OUT OVER 3 SWITCHES (I001, I002, AND I003)  ON THE SOUTH END OF THE YARD JUST INSIDE THE SIGNAL.  THE CONDUCTOR HAD LINED THE SWITCHES AND NOTED NO DEFECTS WITH ANY OF THEM.ANOTHER CREW WAS PUT TOGETHER TO MAKE THE PICK-UP FOR THIS TRAIN AND TAKE IT OUT OF THE YARD FOR THEOUTBOUND CREW.  THIS CREW BROUGHT THE POWER FROM THE ROUNDHOUSE AND COUPLED INTO TRACK I003 AND STARTED PULLING UP THE REMAINING 59 CARS FROM THE INBOUND PORTION OF THIS TRAIN.  AFTER PULLING APPROX30 CARS THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK AND FOUND 4 CARS DRAILED.  AN INSPECTION OF THE SWITCHES ON THE SOUTH END OF THE INDUSTRY TRACK FOUND I001 LINED FOR THE LEAD AND THESWITCH HANDLE IN THE "OPEN" POSITION CAUSING A 1/4 INCH GAP IN THE POINT AND THIS IS WHERE THE DERAILMENT INITIATED.  TRACK I002 WAS LINED FOR TRACK I002 WITH THE HANDLE IN THE "LOCKED" POSITION.  TRACK I003 WAS LINED FOR TRACK I003 WITH THE HANDLE IN THE "OPEN" POSITION AND A 1 1/6 INCH GAP IN THEPOINT.  WHEN THE CREW PULLED THE TRAIN UP TRACK I003 TO MAKE THIER PICKUP, ACFX 80306 DERAILED AT THE TRACK I001 SWITCH.  THE TRAIN CONTINUED NORTHWARD UNTIL GETTING TO THE BRIDGE IN THE MIDDLE OF THEYARD AT WHICH TIME IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  CARS DERAILED WERE ACFX 80306, PROX 78973, CN 710876 AND ETTX 802778.  THREE CARS ENDED UP ON THEIR SIDES.

ID06374-d-06-21-06-NECR.Narrative: TRAIN 611 WAS IN THE SIDING AT PUTNEY  IT WAS RECREWED BY ENG. AND CONDUCTOR.  AFTER AMTRAK TRAIN #55 PASSED PUTNEY, TRAIN 611 BEGAN TO DEPART THE SIDING ON SIGNAL INDICATION. ENG HAD RELEASED THE BRAKES AND THROTTLED UP TO POSITION NUMBER 3 AS THE TRAIN BEGAN TO MOVE IN A SOUTHWARD DIRECTION.  THETRAIN TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 35 CAR LENGTHS WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND CAME TO AN ABRUPTSTOP.  UPON INSPECTION OF THE TRAIN BY THE CREW 13 CARS WERE FOUND DERAILED IN TWO DIFFERENT LOCATIONS.  THE 18TH CAR FROM THE HEAD END, CR 498042, AN OPEN TOP HOPPER LOADED WITH COAL WAS THE FIRST CAR TO DERAIL.  NORTH OF THE CR 498042 EIGHT LOADED CARS WERE DERAILED.  APPROXIMATELY 12 CARS WERE STILL ON THE RAIL, FOLLOWED BY ONE LOADED CAR AND THREE EMPTIES THAT WERE DERAILED.  THE REMAINING PORTION OF THE TRAIN WAS ON THE RAIL TO THE REAR.  UPON DOWNLOADING THE LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE TRAIN REACHED A SPEED OF 14 MPH AND THAT THE THROTTLE POSITION WAS REDUCED FROM NUMBER3  TO 1 RIGHT BEFORE THE TRAIN WENT INTO AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION.RERAILED, TRACK REPAIRED BYR.J. CORMAN.  TRACK REPAIRED BY ECI AND BAZIN BROTHERS.

AFTER FURTHER REVIEW THE ROLLER BEARINGS ON THE CSXT 246341 WERE FOUND TO BE CRACKED.  MUST REPLACE WHEEL SET.  NO DRUG TESTING REQUIRED NOT HUMAN FACTOR.

D530906-d-06-07-06-SLWC.Narrative:
2 MAN SWITCH CREW RETURNING FROM THE WEST END OF THE LAWTON SUB, CAME AROUND A CURVE AND DOWN A SLIGHT INCLINE AT TRACK SPEED 25MPH. ENGINEER SLOWED
TO 5MPH ENTERING A 10MPH SLOW ORDER AT MP644.7 . AS ENGINEER WAS EXITING SLOW ORDER AT MP 644.8 HE FELT TRAIN BEING PULLED DOWN RIGHT BEFORE IT WENT INTO
EMERGENCY. CONDUCTOR WALKED TO THE REAR OF THE TRAIN, CONSIST 18 LOADS 2 EMPTIES, HE FOUND 3 CARS SITTING ON TOP OF ROLLED OVER RAIL ON A BRIDGE. A 4TH CAR, MTY
BOXCAR HAD ROLLED OVER ONTO ITS SIDE. ROADMASTER, CAR FOREMAN, ATM  AND GENERAL MANAGER MET AT THE SITE AND AFTER A THOROUGH INVESTIGATION
DETERMINED THE CAUSE TO BE A THERMAL MISALIGNMENT. A CONTRIBUTING CAUSE WAS INSUFFICIENT BALLAST. INSPECTION RECORDS TO FOLLOW. SEVERAL CROSSTIES HAD BEEN
REPLACED AT THIS LOCATION, BUT THE TAMPING WAS INCOMPLETE.APPROX 500 FEET OF RAIL AND 200 TIES WILL BE REPLACED. DOWNLOAD OF LOCOMOTIVE INDICATES PROPER TRAIN
HANDLING.

D522606-d-06-02-06-SKOL.Narrative: THE CREW WAS SHOVING ASH GROVES CEMENT THE CREW WAS TOLD TO SHOVE THEIR LOADS ON 3 TRACK AND THE EMPTIES ON 5 TRACK.  THEY WERE SHOVING ON 3 TRACK AND THE CONDUCTOR WAS ON THE POINT OF 50 CARS 10 LOADS AND 40 MTY`S. THEY WERE SHOVING APPROXIMATELY 9 MPH.  THE FIRST 10 LOADS AND 2 MTY`S MADE IT OVERTHE # 3 SWITCH POINT INTO 3 TRACK AND THE 13TH CAR AN MTY PICKED THE SWITCH DUE TO A BROKEN SWITCH POINT, AND DERAILED 5 EMPTIES NBIX CARS.  THE SHIPPING SUPERVISOR AT ASHGROVE SAW THE ACTION TAKING PLACE AND SIGNALED TO CONDUCTOR TO STOP THE MOVEMENT.  THIS DERAILMENT TOOK PLACE ON ASH GROVE`S TRACK, THEY HAVE THEIR OWN INSPECTOR FOR INSPECTING THEIR TRACKS, AND THEY ALSO BRING IN AN OUTSIDE INSPECTOR ONCE A MONTH TO INSPECT AS WELL.  REALIZING OUR SAFETY AND THE SAFETY OF THE CUSTOMERS WE WILLBE LOOKING INTO JOINT INSPECTIONS IN THE FUTURE.  ASH GROVE WILL BE INCURRING THE COST OF THIS DERAILMENT AND THE CLEANUP INVOLVED.

524316-d-06-08-06-IC.Primary Accident Cause: Improperly loaded container/trailer on flat car
524316-d-06-08-06-IC.Accident Cause: Improperly loaded container/trailer on flat car
524316-d-06-08-06-IC.Narrative: IT WAS REPORTED BY THE CN POLICE THAT Q19571-08 HAD A LOOSE CONTAINER THAT STRUCK A GRADE CROSSING STRUCTURE IN MAGNOLIA, MS.  A DOOR FROM TRAILER VTRZ738176 WAS FOUND ON THE GROUND ALONG WITH DEBRIS.THE CREW Q19571-08 INSPECTED THEIR TRAIN AT MCCOMB YARD AND FOUND NO DAMAGE TO TRAIN.  HOWEVER, TRAILER VTRZ738176, WHICH WAS ORIGINALLY LOADED ON FLATCAR CN 682780 HAD FALLEN OFF ACCOUNT BEING IMPROPERLY LOADED ONTO CAR.  THE FLATCAR WAS STENCILED FOR 48' TRAILER ONLY AND VTRZ 738176 WAS ONLY 43'.

524456-d-06-10-06-IC.Narrative: TRAIN M33571-09 TRAVELING AT 9 MPH DERAILED SIX CARS WHILE CROSSING OVER FROM MAIN #2 TO MAIN #1 ATTHE TRISTATE CROSSOVERS.  CAR UTCX 48929 WAS ON ITS SIDE, CARS WC 26425 AND ICG 580510 WERE LEANINGAND THE REMAINING THREE DERAILED CARS - SOO 120520, EJE 4548 AND EJE 4124 ALL REMAINED UPRIGHT.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE BRAKEMAN FROM TRAIN R92271-07 FAILED TO LATCH AND LOCK THE MAIN LINE SWITCH.  THIS FAILURE RESULTED IN THE SWITCH FLOATING OVER UNDERNEATH M 33571-09'S MOVEMENT CAUSING THE CARS TO DERAIL.

524570-d-06-11-06-IC.Narrative: TRAIN R96791-11 WAS SHOVING 38 CARS SOUTH AT APPROX. 5MPH WITH THE BRAKEMAN RIDING THE POINT OF THESHOVE, FROM 3 SOUTH TOWARDS CARS ON 3 NORTH.  THE BRAKEMAN HAD LINED THE SWITCHES FOR STRAIGHT MOVEMENT AND GAVE THE ENGINEER THE PROCEED COMMAND TO HEAD SOUTH . AS THE TRAIN PROCEEDED SOUTH , THE BRAKEMAN STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AND THEN HAD IT BACK UP.  TRAIN WENT APPROX. 10 CAR LENGTHS AND THEN WENTINTO EMERGENCY.  THE TRAIN HAD RUN THE SOUTH XOVER FROM 3 TO 4  AND WHEN THEY SHOVED NORTH DERAILEDWCHX 30065.  WCHX 30066  AND WCHX 30092.  THE SWITCH WAS NOT LINED PROPERLY FOR THE MOVEMENT AND THE ENGINEER ASSUMED THAT IT WAS AND DID NOT LOOK BEFORE PASSING THRU IT.

CRLCS06016-d-06-08-06-CRL.Narrative:
ON 7-8 AT 1:20 AM THE 20:00 SOUTH CHICAGO CREW WAS PULLING 29 CARS FROM SOUTH CHICAGO TO IRONDALE WHEN TRAIN SLOWED ABRUPTLY. ENGINEER STOPPED TRAIN IMMEDIATELY. CONDUCTOR THEN WALKED THE TRAIN ADN FOUND 9 CARS DERAILED. THE TRAIN DID NOT GO INTO EMERGENCY AS THE TRAIN LINE WA NEVER COMPROMISED. ALLCARS WERE UPRIGHT WITH NO LADING DAMAGE. APPROXIMATELY 1800 FEET OF TRACK WAS DAMAGED.
CAUSE OF DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE STIFF TRUCKS ON WSOR 12554.

053543-d-06-12-06-CRSH.Narrative: CAUSED BY BACK SIDE OF THE LEAD WHEEL OF DTTX 56786 RIDING UP AND ACROSS THE TOP OF GUARD RAIL OF LEADING #10 TURNOUT TO THE RIGHT FOR THE CROSSOVER TO CHEMICAL COAST SECONDARY TRACK AND AT THE SAME TIME THE OPPOSITE WHEEL CLIMBED THE POINT OF THE FROG. THIS WAS THE RESULT OF THIS WHEEL SET EXITINGPRIOR 13 TO 16 DEGREE CURVE TO THE LEFT ON THE CONNECTING TRACK AND BEING ROTATED TOWARD THE GUARD RAIL AND FROG WITHOUT ANY  INTERVENING TANGENT PREVENTING THE WHEEL SET FROM COMPLETELY STEERING BACKTO NEUTRAL OR CENTERED ORIENTATION CREATING A HIGH SINGLE OF ATTACK AGAINST THE GUARD RAIL OF THE FROG.

A026106-d-06-01-06-ACEX.Narrative: ON JUNE 1, 2006 AT APPROX. 5:36 PM, ACE #02 WAS OPERATING EASTBOUND ON TE UNION PACIFIC'S FRESNO SUBDIVISION MAIN TRACK #2.  WHILE IN THE PROCESS OF ACCELERATING TO MAXIMUM AUTHORIZED SPEED THE SECTION OF TRACK THE ENGINEER OBSERVED A VEHICLE BEING INTENTIONALLY AROUND THE LOWERED CROSSING GATES ATROTH ROAD (MP 90.84.  THE ENGINEER IMMEDIATELY PLACED THE TRAIN'S AIR BRAKES SYSTEM IN EMERGENCY, STRIKING THE LEFT REAR QUARTER PANEL OF THE VEHICLE MOMENTS LATER. INITIAL IMPACT WITH THE LEFT FRONTPORTION OF THE CAB REPOSITIONED THE VEHICLE TO A LOCATION THAT CAUSED IT TO BE STRUCK A SECOND TIMEBY T"A END-LEFT SIDE SILL STEP BELOW DOOR LEAFS 1 AND 2.

061006-d-06-10-06-AGCR.Narrative: SWITCHMAN WAS WATCHING SHOVE BACK INTO THE YARD.  HE THOUGHT THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR #2 TRACK WHENIN FACT IT WAS LINED FOR #1 TRACK.  THE TRAIN WAS TO BE PARKED ON #1 TRACK, SO THE SWITCHMAN LINED THE TRACK FOR WHAT HE THOUGHT WAS TRK #1.  IN REALITY HE LINED IT FOR #2 TRK.  WHEN HE REALIZED HIS MISTAKE AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TO BRING THE TRAIN TO A STOP IT WAS TO LATE.  THE LAST CAR STRUCK THE CARS THAT WERE PARKED IN #2 TRK.  THE CARS COLLIDED KNUCKLE TO KNUCKLE AND THERE WAS NO DAMAGE. THE 7MPH IMPACTED DID CAUSE THE DOORS TO COME OPEN ON 2 CARS GCCX680086 AND GCCX680152 WHICH SPILLED MATERIALS ON RAIL.  BOTH ENGINEER AND SWITCHMAN WERE UNAWARE DOORS HAD OPENED, SO WHEN THEY PULLED TRAINOUT  TO PUT IT IN #1 TRK.  THEY DERAILED 7 CARS AND DID NOT KNOW.  THEY THEN SHOVED BACK INTO TRK.#1 AND DERAILED THE 7 CARS EVEN MORE.  THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AT 0945, AND AT 0945 THE DAY SHIFT REPORTED THE DERAILMENT TO SUPERINTENDENT..
